results.title: Great Cognito
results.creator_credit: Will Vinton Productions and Will Vinton
results.brief_description: The most recent Will Vinton clay animated production introduces the Great Cognito a talented impersonator who really throws himself into his work. Accompanying his visual metamorphoses with a rapid-fire commentary, he entertains his audience with hilarious impersonations of public figures.

results.title: Gorillas in the Mist: The Story of Dian Fossey
results.creator_credit: Terence A. Clegg, Arne Glimcher, Guber-Peters Company and Michael Apted
results.brief_description: Based on the true story of anthropologist Dian Fossey who travels to the African mountains to study the rare gorillas. Her interest in the mountain gorillas becomes an obsession and she risks her life to protect them from poachers and animal traders and ultimate extinction. Stars Sigourney Weaver and Bryan Brown.

results.title: Goodbye Sousa
results.creator_credit: George Pearson, ONF | NFB and Tony Ianzelo
results.brief_description: The Newmarket Citizens Band, one of Ontario’s best, has been playing the rousing marches of John Philip Sousa for over one hundred years. While other small-town bands may be fading, the Newmarket band is still going strong. To this film’s toe-tapping rhythms you learn the reasons why. (Award: Montreal.)

results.title: Good Will Hunting (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Gus Van Sant, Lawrence Bender and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Will Hunting (Matt Damon) is a janitor from working-class South Boston, but he is in fact a genius. Abused as a child, he has been in trouble with the law ever since, and is finally facing a jail sentence. In order to save his relationship with his girlfriend (Minnie Driver), and to stay out of jail, Will agrees to receive counselling. With his therapist Sean (Robin Williams), he starts to transform his life. This is the poignant story of both Will and Sean coming to terms with the blows life has dealt them, and the unknown future. Cast includes Ben Affleck, who features as Will’s best friend, and Casey Affleck. (Awards: Academy Awards, Robin Williams for Best Supporting Actor, and Matt Damon/Ben Affleck for Best Screenplay)

results.title: Going my way
results.brief_description: This is the nostalgic and heartwarming story of young Father O’Malley (Bing Crosby), sent by his Bishop to help Father Fitzgibbon (Barry Fitzgerald) at the mortgage-ridden St Dominic’s parish. Initially, the younger priest’s unconventional methods antagonise his gruff superior, but eventually Father O’Malley wins over the elderly priest, organises a gang of unruly kids into a choir, and rescues the parish from debt. Bing Crosby sings the famed songs: “Too-Ra-Loo-Ra-Loo-Ra” and “Swinging on a star”. This outstanding film won 7 Academy Awards including Best Picture, Best Actor (Bing Crosby) and Best Supporting Actor (Barry Fitzgerald).

results.title: Gidget
results.creator_credit: Paul Wendkos, Lewis Rachmil and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: A classic teenage film filled with sun, surf and romance. Sandra Dee became the stereotypical blonde haired blue-eyed surfer girl in this first Gidget movie. Francie Lawrence desperately wants to find true love at 16, and becomes a mascot for a group of college-bound surfer boys and their drop-out leader the Great Kahoona, played by Cliff Robertson. During the summer vacation she becomes attracted to Moondoggie played by James Darren. Gidget does everything to make him fall for her and by the end of the summer her dreams come true.

results.title: Giantland
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney, United Artists Corporation and Burt Gillett
results.brief_description: Mickey tells a crowd of orphans a version of “Jack and the Beanstalk” in which he plays the leading role and takes on Rumplewatt, the “king of the giants - prince of the tyrants.”

results.title: Ghost in the shell (D)
results.creator_credit: Mamoru Oshii, Mitsuhisa ishikawa, Ken Iyadomi, Ken Matsumoto, Yoshimasa Mizou, Bondai Visual, Manga Entertainment and Kodonsha
results.brief_description: In the tradition of ‘Akira’, ‘Ghost in the shell’ features excellent animation which will impress. Set in the cyberspace worlds of artificial intelligence and sophisticated computer technology, this violent and complex adventure revolves around a ghostly agent whose job is to determine who is real and who is a cybernetic creation. When a master hacker learns to break into the minds of his victims, the ‘Ghost in the shell’ must foil his evil attempts.
